title: Britain’s most expensive beach hut sells for £275k - and it doesn't even face the sea
text:
The beach hut sold for a whopping £275k (Photo: Denisons/BNPS) Share   
A beach hut on a sandy spit has sold for a whopping £275,000 - and it doesn't even face the sea. 
The small timber cabin can only be slept in for part of the year and the new owners will have to share communal bathroom facilities. 
But the sky-high price tag is down to its location on the exclusive Mudeford Spit in Christchurch, Dorset, which is home to the most expensive beach huts in the country. 
Hut 128 backs on to a sea-facing cabin on the picturesque peninsula and looks out on to Christchurch Harbour. Read More The small timber cabin can only be slept in for part of the year (Photo: Denisons/BNPS) The hut doesn't even face the sea (Photo: Denisons/BNPS) 
While most huts at Mudeford have a first floor area and can sleep six people, Hut 128 is on one level. 
But measuring 18ft 10ins by 11ft 3ins, it is slightly bigger than most other huts and so there is lots of potential for the new owners to make it one of the finest on the spit. 
In its present form it sleeps four to six people on bunk beds and fold-out sofa-beds. 
It has a kitchenette with a fridge, sink and oven run on gas bottles, a decked area at the front and storage space underneath. 
There is no running water or mains electricity. It is a short walk to the communal shower block and toilets. In its present form it sleeps four to six people on bunk beds and fold-out sofa-beds (Photo: Denisons/BNPS) There is no running water or mains electricity (Photo: BNPS) 
Local estate agents Denisons say interest in the sought-after huts has risen in recent years, with several huts selling for between £265,00 to £275,000. 
The same price could buy a three or four-bedroom house in other parts of the country. 
The remote sandbank can only be accessed by a 30-minute walk, a ride on a novelty land train or a short ferry trip but its isolated position is what gives it its exclusivity. 
This hut has panoramic views across the harbour towards Mudeford and Hengistbury Head, with the spit's beautiful sandy beaches behind it. 
As well as the eye-watering purchase price, the new owners will also have to pay annual rates to the local council of about £500 and a licence fee of about £4,500 a year. Read More You can buy your own CASTLE in the Midlands for the same price as a London flat This hut has panoramic views across the harbour towards Mudeford and Hengistbury Head (Photo: Denisons/BNPS) Interest in the sought-after huts has risen in recent years, with several huts selling for between £265,00 to £275,000 (Photo: Denisons/BNPS) 
Andy Denison from the estate agents said: "The prices are a fraction up on last year but that does not put people off. 
"We have had several sell for similar prices - that is what people are willing to pay. 
"There is a cross-section of people who buy them with some living locally as well as London buyers. 
"It is not the same as most house purchases because they are cash buyers and the money is transferred straightaway. 
"It is an incredibly sought-after area and people are buying in to a lifestyle." The remote sandbank can only be accessed by a 30-minute walk, a ride on a novelty land train or a short ferry trip (Photo: RoyKilcullen/BNPS) The new owners will also have to pay annual rates to the local council of about £500 and a licence fee of about £4,500 a year (Photo: Denisons/BNPS) 
Mr Denison said he has a waiting list of people who are interested and the huts sell almost immediately. 
The agents have another hut for sale for £250,000 which is on the beach side of the spit. It also sleeps four to six people and has a mezzanine floor, kitchen area and sun deck. Like us on Facebook
